form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES
form.official-title: To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act to extend through 2018 the authority of the Federal Election Commission to impose civil money penalties on the basis of a schedule of penalties established and published by the Commission, to expand such authority to certain other violations, and for other purposes.

section.header: Extension of administrative penalty authority of Federal Election Commission through 2018
section.text: Section 309(a)(4)(C)(iv) of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 (2 U.S.C. 437g(a)(4)(C)(iv)) is amended by striking December 31, 2013 and inserting December 31, 2018.

section.header: Expansion of administrative penalty authority of Federal Election Commission

subsection.text: Section 309(a)(4)(C)(i) of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 (2 U.S.C. 437g(a)(4)(C)(i)) is amended by striking any requirement of section 304(a) of the Act (2 U.S.C. 434(a)) and inserting a qualified disclosure requirement.

subsection.header: Schedule of penalties for each violation
subsection.text: Section 309(a)(4)(C)(i)(II) of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 (2 U.S.C. 437g(a)(4)(C)(i)(II)) is amended by inserting , for violations of each qualified disclosure requirement, before under a schedule of penalties.
Section 309(a)(4)(C) of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 (2 U.S.C. 437g(a)(4)(C)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating clause (iv), as amended by section 1, as clause (v); and
by inserting after clause (iii) the following new clause:

clause.text: In this subparagraph, the term qualified disclosure requirement means any requirement of—

section.text: The amendments made by this Act shall take effect on the earlier of—

paragraph.text: the date of the enactment of this Act.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives November 18, 2013.
